ai-atk-s0510a30:3_1: got rid of the daggery, the flowers of the fairies, and lotus ponds.
ai-atk-s0510a30:4_0: there are five kinds of suffering:
ai-atk-s0510a30:5_1: having practiced the sixth lost the world,
ai-atk-s0510a30:5_2: There are people among the Kokanadā, Pajjunna’s daughter, millet,
ai-atk-s0510a30:5_3: I’m blind and deaf. But because I’m blinded by blind people in the Dark Forest. I don’t want to listen.
ai-atk-s0510a30:5_4: leaving the Buddha’s instruction and find out about the way I’ve seen a seat, whether he wants to offer a seat.
ai-atk-s0510a30:5_5: He should put his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and say, “You should put his joined palms toward those who are doing it.”
ai-atk-s0510a30:5_6: But they snapped the world with their own eyes, and drools clean, withering delight extinguishment, thinking, ‘That’s what they need.’
ai-atk-s0510a30:6_1: of giving this mark to Mahāvijita a great man, a transformation of the thirty-two marks of a great man, and the Buddha followed you.
ai-atk-s0510a30:8_0: Mindfulness of the Both from the gods.
